name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is:
• OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
1.3 Submission & Approval of Concrete Mix Design
FREQUENCY: Prior to first concrete pour
• The Contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete.
• Concrete shall not be placed until the mix design has been reviewed by the Superintendent, and allocated a registration number on the Register of VicRoads approved concrete mixes.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Mix design approval
• Set out work in accordance with drawings.
• The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work.
• No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
• Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
• Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation completed to required depth to allow placement of the bedding layer
• All bedding material used shall be as follows:
– 100mm thick layer of 20mm Class 3 crushed rock bedding for median infill
– 150mm thick layer of 20mm Class 4 crushed rock bedding for footpath/pram crossing
– Bedding trimmed, moistened, and compacted as per Section 304
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall comply with the requirements of AS 3610
• Reinforment used shall consist of SL82 mesh is to be placed with a minimum cover of 50mm from the top (unless shown otherwise on drawings).
• Reinforcement must comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4671.

• Concrete shall be thoroughly compaction via contious tamping and internal vibration. Where concrete is unformed it shall be hand tamped to a smooth surface and screeded in accordance with the construction drawings.
• Where fresh concrete is being placed against concrete which has taken initial set a properly formed construction joint must be used.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• Concrete elements shall have a Class 3 surface finish for external surfaces and a Class 4 surface finish for permanently hidden surfaces in accordance with AS 3610.
• Footpaths and other Surfacing shall be compelted with a wooden float.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• Ensure that pram crossings are constructed in accordance with requirements for access and mobility.
– For pram crossings within concrete kerb refer to Figure 24A of AS 1428.1
– Pram crossings within bluestone kerb shall be constructed as per relevant standard drawings (1P 50406 for City of Melbourne)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• Expansion joints shall be installated at 10m regular intervals using 15mm wide cork or bituminous imtergrate particle board.
• Control joints at 2.5m regular intervals, 25% of pavement depth and 5mm wide
• Prevent bonding between edging and surfacing. Either paint back of edging with bitumen or use a strip of bituminous felt material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.
• Vehicles equal to or less than 1.5 tonnes in weight may be permitted to cross after 4 days, vehicles greater than 1.5 tonnes may be permitted to cross after 7 days.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• Concrete shall be cured immediately either by water curing, wet hessian, polyethylene sheeting which is adequately sealed, curing compound or a combination of these.
• Curing compounds shall comply with AS 3799. The curing compound shall be applied in two coats using a fine spray at the rate stated on the certificate of compliance
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
3.1 Carry out sampling of concrete - strength and consistency
• Sampling and testing of the strength of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 6.2 of AS 1379.
• The consistency of the concrete shall be determined by a slump test of each concrete strength sample in accordance with AS 1012.3 and Clause 5.2 of AS 1379
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed/Test Records
• Where matching in with existing surface levels, the new surface shall be within ± 5mm existing.
• Section dimensions shall be constructed within the following tolerances:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
• After curing, no earlier than 3 days, backfilling shall be completed as per the below:
– Width ≥ 300mm behind edging to top of edging
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to the first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural Concrete Design & Submission ITP completed and signed.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
• Reinforcement schedule has been prepared for the reinforcement supply, to ensure that it achieves the specified tolerances on member dimensions, concrete cover and specified locations
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
• The Contractor shall notify the Superintendent for inspection of the pile excavation by the Superintendent.

• Prior to inspection, the pile excavation shall be de?watered and the walls and base of the pile cleaned out, including the internal surface of the casing, to remove all mud, loose or foreign material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

• Designed and constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete. Formwork/shoring shall be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures can be inspected, and sufficiently tight at joints to prevent loss of slurry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

• Further to the requirements of clause 611.10 spacers and supports for bored pile steel reinforcement shall be placed at intervals of no more than 2 m along the full length of the steel reinforcement cage to ensure that the specified concrete cover to the steel reinforcement is maintained.
• Concrete shall be placed through a tremie tube and shall not be dropped from a height greater than 2 m through air.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be placed until all foreign material has been completely removed from the forms
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.2 Correct forms, reinforcements, rag bolt assembly and embedments
• Superintendent confirms that the inspected formwork, reinforcement, rag bolt assembly and embedments comply with the project drawings and specifications.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed & Pre-Pour checklist completed
• Reinforcement and/or concrete shall not be placed until the proposed method of removing mud, loose rock or similar materials has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
• Concrete shall not be place when temperature is <5°C or > 35°C
• All steel components that are in contact with the concrete shall be cooled to below 32°C before concrete is placed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling in accordance with 610.16
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
• Discharge time (concrete placed and compacted) < 90 minutes from batch time unless approved otherwise.
• Batch to be used has a discharge time of 180 minutes. Boral VR400/40 (SCC) (180min')
• Concrete shall be tansported, handled and placed in a manner that will prevent segregation or loss of materials
• In continuous pours the max. time lag between truckloads on site is 25 minutes
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
• Unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent, temporary casing shall be used to prevent collapse of holes during the excavation operation.
• Care shall be taken to prevent soil and rock dislodging from the side of the hole and contaminating the concrete forming the minimum cover to the reinforcement.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sufficient time shall be given for the concrete to cure prior to loading.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
• Formwork shall be removed carefully and in such a manner as to avoid damage to the member or the concrete surfaces and maintain safety at all stages of removal.
• Formwork and formwork supports shall not be disturbed or adjusted during the concreting operation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
5.3 Positional tolerance and dimensions of concrete members and piles
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The centre of the pile head shall be in the specified plan position ±75 mm;
5.4 Concrete Sampling and Testing Self-Compacting Concrete VR400/40
• Concrete sampled and tested for Compressive Strength:
– 2 cylinders @ 28 days for VPV=13% & Compressive Strength=40MPa
• Passing Ability of less than or equal to 10mm
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any piling
• No pile construction shall be commenced within 2.5 m clear distance of a newly cast pile until the concrete in the pile has attained a strength of 15 MPa.

• Installation of piles by methods which involve driven temporary casing or result in significant vibration shall not be carried out within the distance 2.5 m to 9.0 m until the concrete in the pile has attained a strength of 15 MPa and set for a minimum of 24 hours.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where necessary, piles shall be tested in accordance with 606.07; integrity testing, static load testing & dynamic testing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Recorded of as-built drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
